meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of alchemy.
meanings.sent1: The alchemic symbols on the old book fascinated the young student.
meanings.sent2: Her necklace had an alchemic charm that seemed to glow in the moonlight.
meanings.sent3: The alchemic potion turned the cat into a tiny dragon for a day.
meanings.sent4: His words had an alchemic effect, soothing the crowd's anger.
meanings.sent5: The alchemic process of transformation was both mysterious and beautiful.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the ancient art of alchemy.
meanings.sent1: The alchemic texts were carefully preserved in the hidden library.
meanings.sent2: The alchemic experiments were conducted in secrecy and silence.
meanings.sent3: The alchemic ingredients smelled like a mix of herbs and magic.
meanings.sent4: Her smile held an alchemic power, brightening even the darkest days.
meanings.sent5: The alchemic rituals were performed under the light of the full moon.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or properties associated with alchemy.
meanings.sent1: The old house had an alchemic atmosphere, filled with mystery.
meanings.sent2: The alchemic aura of the room made her feel like she was in a different time.
meanings.sent3: The alchemic energy in the air tingled on her skin like tiny sparks.
meanings.sent4: The alchemic nature of the artifact seemed to hold ancient secrets.
meanings.sent5: The alchemic essence of the potion shimmered in the glass vial.
